citation.article-title: Thiomonas islandica sp. nov., a moderately thermophilic, hydrogen- and sulfur-oxidizing betaproteobacterium isolated from a hot spring
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Thiomonas islandica sp. nov.
Thiomonas islandica (is.lan′di.ca. N.L. fem. adj. islandica Icelandic, describing the place of first isolation).
Cells are straight rods, 1.7×0.4 μm, occurring singly, motile and Gram-reaction-negative.
Colonies grown on solid DSM81 medium are greyish, round and ∼1 mm in diameter.
Moderately thermophilic with an optimum temperature for growth of 45 °C.
No growth occurs at 30 °C or below or at 55 °C and higher.
Optimum pH for growth under heterotrophic conditions is pH 4.
Shows heterotrophic, chemolithotrophic and mixotrophic growth properties.
Shows heterotrophic growth on acetate, oxalate, pyruvate and on glutamate in the presence of yeast extract.

No growth occurs on propionate, butyrate, formate, crotonate, lactate, malate, succinate, aspartate, alanine, glycine, serine, threonine, histidine, xylose, glucose, mannose, fructose, galactose, sucrose, yeast extract, peptone, tryptone, beef extract or Casamino acids.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 65.2 mol%.
The type strain, 6CT (=DSM 21436T =JCM 16107T), was isolated from a clayish liquid sample of a hot spring in Graendalur, south-western Iceland.
